clinical_study.brief_title: Multifocal Electroretinography Before and After Silicone Oil Removal
clinical_study.official_title: Multifocal Electroretinography Before and After Silicone Oil Removal

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational study to investigate the changes in multifocal electroretinogram signal before and after silicone oil removal in silicone-filled eyes.

primary_outcome.description: Change in amplitudes of P1 and N1 waves before and after silicone oil removal

intervention.description: A device that records electric potentials generated by the retinal photoreceptors and neural elements in a multifocal fashion

study_pop.textblock: A total of 30 patients will be recruited. We will include patients 18 years of age or older who underwent PPV for the repair of rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RRD) and received silicone oil as an intraocular tamponade. Patients will be excluded if they have a significant corneal opacity, uncontrolled intraocular pressure, a confounding macular pathology or optic nerve pathology or if silicone oil has been in the eye for longer than 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients 18 years of age or older who underwent pars plana vitrectomy for the repair of rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RRD) and received silicone oil as an intraocular tamponade.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be excluded if they have a significant corneal opacity, uncontrolled intraocular pressure, a confounding macular pathology or optic nerve pathology or if silicone oil has been in the eye for longer than 6 months.
